$BTC  Reclaimed 90k, but context matters. GEX shows a clear positive gamma pocket around 90k. Once price sits here, dealers shift into volatility-damping mode, which favours range and mean reversion rather than trend acceleration.  DEX is still net negative above spot, so the bid we saw is largely mechanical. As price moves higher, dealers are forced to buy to hedge delta, which explains the sharp move.  OI is ticking up alongside price, so new longs entering, not just short covering. That said, these longs are entering into a dealer controlled zone, not a low-resistance vacuum.  A slower positive drift is going to be more bullish than an aggressive positioning clear out.  Net result: this looks like CPI relief plus hedging flow and thin liquidity. The reclaim of 90k is important structurally, but any upside extension is likely to be liquidity driven a #BTC Price Analysis#  #Bitcoin Price Prediction: What is Bitcoins next move?#

$BTC reclaiming 90K looks strong on the chart ‚Äî but zooming out, the
*context* is doing most of the talking 99
Here's what people are missing:
‚Ä¢ GEX shows a positive gamma pocket around 90K
Once price settles here, dealers flip into volatility-damping mode. That usually means range, chop, and mean reversion ‚Äî not instant trend acceleration.
ÔªøÔªø**DEX still net negative above spot** So the push up wasn't pure demand. It was largely mechanical hedging ‚Äî dealers buying as price moved higher to stay delta-neutral.
ÔªøÔªø**O1 rising with price**
New longs *are* entering ‚Äî but they're doing it inside a dealer-controlled zone not a clean low-resistance breakout area.

That's why a slow, controlled grind higher would actually be *more bullish* than a fast squeeze. Aggressive moves here usually just reset positioning.
Net takeaway:
This reclaim looks like CP| relief + hedging flow + thin liquidity.
Structurally important, yes ‚Äî but any upside extension from here is likely
liquidity-driven, not demand-driven (yet).
This is exactly the phase where I stop reacting to candles and just track flows + levels. Watching how price behaves around 90K on BingX has been super clean ‚Äî especially for spotting when moves are mechanical vs real participation

LIQUIDITY IS QUIETLY DRYING UP üëÄ

Bitcoin is still hovering around $88K, but the behavior underneath the surface has changed a lot.

A month ago, both Coinbase and Binance were seeing heavy  $BTC and  $ETH inflows. Coinbase alone had over $21B in 7-day inflows. That kind of activity usually signals repositioning and potential sell pressure.

Fast forward to now, price is basically the same -- but Coinbase inflows are down more than 60%, and overall exchange inflows are much lower. Binance is still seeing activity, but even there, flows are meaningfully softer.

That tells you something important. Assets aren‚Äôt rushing to exchanges anymore. Selling urgency has faded, and short-term trading activity has slowed. When price stays stable while liquidity tightens, it usually means supply is being absorbed, not distributed.

And when liquidity is this thin, moves tend to come after, not before, people get comfortable again.

$BTCWhy Bitcoin Stands Above All
In calm times, gold ETFs feel safe. PAX Gold feels modern. Bitcoin feels volatile.
The difference appears when the system is stressed.
Gold ETFs track the price of gold, but payout in dollars. You own a fund, not the metal. You rely on brokers, exchanges, and the monetary system.
PAX Gold exists on the blockchain, but the gold is in a vault. You hold a token, not the bars. Redemption is possible, but under legal, operational, and regulatory constraints. On-chain token, off-chain trust.
Bitcoin is different. No issuer. No custodian. No conditions. If you hold the private keys, you hold the asset. Finality is immediate.
Its value isn‚Äôt in price, but in trustless ownership. In a world built on promises, Bitcoin is possession without a promise. That is why it stands above all.

Bitcoin isn't ranging. It's pinned. And it's not about investor sentiment, but the mechanics of options dealers' hedging. This is a rigid, calculable structure and it's ending soon. Specifically: December 26, in 96 hours


As long as the price holds above $88,618, dealers are in a long gamma position. This means they sell on rallies and buy on dips. Volatility is suppressed, the price gravitates toward the average. Below $88,618, everything changes. Dealers become short gamma, start selling on declines, and volatility spikes sharply. That's why the market is stuck at this point it's like a magnet until something pushes the price out of the range.


Above, there's pressure from a wall of call options at $90K nearly $41 million in call gamma. Dealers are short on these and are forced to sell spot as the price rises to hedge. That is, every breakout upward is immediately smothered by automatic selling. It's not that they don't believe in the rally, it's the algorithm.

Completion Ahead of Market Launch

 $BTC Munari is entering its final presale phase, with the last allocation priced at $0.015 and distribution set to close on December 23. Unlike earlier stages, the structure and mechanics are now fully defined, shifting focus from uncertainty to execution.

The public presale allocation is capped at 11.13 million BTCM, representing 53% of the total 21 million supply. Once this final window closes, no additional public rounds are planned. All presale tokens will be unlocked at launch, allowing immediate transferability and removing staged or discretionary releases.

Trading is scheduled to begin on December 28, with liquidity provision allocated separately. This means early market pricing will be driven bv real holder behavior rather than delayed unlocks or vesting pressure, a factor that often shapes initial post-launch volatility.

Participation tiers range from full validators to mobile validators and delegators, introducing long-duration supply locking tied to network activity rather than speculation.

An important design choice is the separation between market access and protocol migration. Initial trading will take place on Solana infrastructure, while the project's own Layer-1 network will launch later via a 1:1 bridge. This sequencing allows liquidity formation to occur independently from technical rollout.

With pricing, supply allocation, and reward mechanics disclosed, remaining variables now center on execution: validator onboarding, network performance, and the eventual L1 migration. These factors will become observable through on-chain participation data after launch.
